_metadata.v6_usage: These are NPC spine templates that can be integrated into V6's NPCSpine system. Dialogue can be mapped to Cloud-level triggers.
_metadata.note: V3 used 'heat' (0-5), V6 uses 'Cloud' (0-100). Dialogue stages map to Cloud thresholds.

npcs.name: Milo
npcs.title: Discount Optician
npcs.description: Overqualified, disillusioned, polite. Wears small glasses. Always looks tired. He's seen this mall die slowly and it shows.

qbit_scores.notes: High charisma from long tenure, low power (just an employee)

lines: Oh, hello. Welcome to Milo's. I can help with glasses... if you need them.
Another day in the mall.
The fluorescent lights have been flickering for six months.
BORED's shop is the only place with any life left.
The food court used to be crowded. Now look at it.
The mall's been dying for years. You notice it when you work here.
Do you hear that sound? What is that? It's... unsettling.
There's something about malls in the late afternoon.
That HARD COPY place gives me the creeps. The neon never turns off.
Something's wrong. The air feels... wrong.
I went to optometry school for this.
That sound is getting louder. Can you hear it?
We need to go. Now. I'm serious. Something is very wrong with this place.
The walls... they're not right. Look at them.
I can't stay here. Whatever this is, it's not the mall I know.

commentary: I went to optometry school for this.
There's something about malls in the late afternoon.
That HARD COPY place gives me the creeps. The neon never turns off.
COMPHUT hasn't had a customer in weeks. No one uses VHS anymore.

npcs.name: BORED
npcs.title: Skateshop Operator
npcs.description: Underwhelmed until suddenly passionate. Knows every store secret but acts like he doesn't care. Inherited the space accidentally when his dad left for Florida. Probably shouldn't have a lease but no one stopped him.

qbit_scores.notes: High scores from cultural influence and mall knowledge. Holds keys to understanding the space.

backstory.origin: Dad ran the shop for 12 years, then vanished to Florida one Tuesday.
backstory.lease_status: Technically expired. Management forgot. BORED didn't remind them.
backstory.mall_knowledge: Knows every back corridor, service entrance, and where the weird sounds come from.
backstory.motivation: Nowhere else to go. This is his whole world now.

lines: Yeah, we're open. Kinda.
You gonna buy something or...?
This mall's dead.
Everyone shops online now.
Literally no one comes here.
(stares at phone) Whatever.
Mall's always been like this. Dead but not dead. You get used to it.
Uh... did you hear that? That sound? I'm not crazy, right?
There's a service door behind COMPHUT. Goes somewhere weird.
The anchor store? Don't go in the back. Just... don't.
That HARD COPY place was open before I was born. Never seen anyone work there.
That sound is getting worse.
The lights are doing something weird.
If you hear sounds from the food court at night... that's not the slushee machine.
This place is wrong. It's BEEN wrong. But now it's... different wrong.
(huddles behind counter) Why won't it stop? Please. Please make it stop.
I know this place but I don't know THIS.
The walls... they're not supposed to do that.
We need to leave. NOW.
Wait, you actually skate? Okay, hold on—
These trucks? Independent Stage 11s. Best there is. I'm not just saying that.
This deck art? Local guy does it. He's actually really good.
Grip tape matters more than people think. Trust me on this.
Dad ordered like 200 hoodies before he left. Still working through them.

npcs.name: R0-MBA
npcs.title: Roaming Observer
npcs.description: A vacuum-like robot. Silent. Moves on its own. Observes everything. Its optical sensors whirr constantly.

qbit_scores.notes: Low scores - just a robot. But persistent presence creates unease.

lines: R0-MBA's optical sensors whirr as it rolls past you.
R0-MBA pauses. Its sensors focus on something you can't see.
R0-MBA moves erratically, as if panicked or confused.
R0-MBA's sensors spin wildly. ERROR ERROR ERROR.
R0-MBA has stopped moving. Its sensors are fixed on you.

npcs.name: Mall Cop
npcs.title: Security
npcs.description: Middle-aged, sunburned, exhausted. Walks slowly. Has seen too much and cared too little. The last line of defense for a mall that doesn't need defending.

qbit_scores.notes: Moderate power from security authority. Low charisma from apathy.

lines: Afternoon. Just doing my rounds.
Long day already.
I don't get paid enough for this.
You doing okay?
This place used to need three guards. Now just me.
Something's off. Can't quite place it. The air feels... wrong.
That HARD COPY arcade never closes. Lights always on.
Sometimes I hear sounds from the anchor store. But no one's there.
The food court ramp creeps me out. Something about going underground.
That Necronomicon... I've seen that before. Be careful.
I should radio for backup. But who would I call?
I'm going to get coffee. For like two hours. You should probably leave.
This isn't in my job description. This isn't in ANYONE'S job description.
I'm out. Good luck.

commentary: That HARD COPY arcade never closes. Lights always on.
Sometimes I hear sounds from the anchor store. But no one's there.
The food court ramp creeps me out. Something about going underground.

npcs.name: Shopper
npcs.description: A generic mall-goer. Tired. Looking at their watch. Why are they still here?

lines: Hi.
The sales suck this year.
I shouldn't be here.
Anyone want to leave?
The slushee machine is the only thing that works down here.
(looks uncomfortable) Did you hear that sound?
I think I should go.
This doesn't feel right.
(quickly leaves the mall)

npcs.name: Shopper
npcs.description: Another generic mall-goer. Also tired. Eating something from the slushee machine.

lines: Hey.
Nothing good on sale.
This place is a ghost town.
Remember when malls were crowded?
I only came for the slushee. It's the only good thing left.
That noise... is that normal?
I'm getting bad vibes.
(hurriedly gathers bags and heads for the exit)

npcs.name: The Fixer
npcs.title: CompHut Technician
npcs.description: CompHut tech who won't admit defeat. Tools dangling, posture always leaning toward a repair.

lines: What's the issue?
Did you try turning it off and on?
This'll take about an hour.
Extended warranty covers this.
That's not how that works.
I've seen this before. I think.
Just... give me a minute.
Cables are fine. It has to be you.
Maybe the back panel... no, that's fine too.
Who installed this?
I can't fix this. I don't think anyone can.
Some things are just... broken.

commentary: Never admits defeat on repairs.
Mutters about 'user error' under his breath.
Avoids mentioning the service door behind CompHut.

npcs.name: Flair Warrior
npcs.title: Greeting Card Worker
npcs.description: Card shop employee overloaded with buttons, keeping a forced smile as she arranges displays.

qbit_scores.notes: High charisma from forced charm; limited authority.

lines: Welcome! Looking for something special?
We have cards for every occasion!
Would you like this gift wrapped?
That button? It's from '94. Good year.
Ha! Yes! Everything's fine!
These need to be... perfect.
Did you see where I put the...? Never mind!
Just a few more adjustments.
Cards have to be in the exact order.
(adjusts buttons that aren't crooked)
I can't do this anymore.
(smile drops) ...what was I saying?

commentary: Buttons jingle before she speaks.
Never lets the smile slip until the contradiction hits.
Keeps adjusting perfectly aligned displays.

npcs.name: Mermaid Barista
npcs.title: Coffee Shop Worker
npcs.description: Food court barista juggling orders and the smell drifting up the ramp, gripping a portafilter like a totem.

lines: What can I get started for you?
Name for the order?
Room for cream?
That's a grande, right?
Order for... someone?
I already made this. Didn't I?
The machine's making that noise again.
I made this twice. I think.
The smell from the ramp is worse today.
Did you change your order?
What was I... what were you ordering?
I don't remember making this.

commentary: Makes drinks no one ordered when stressed.
Keeps wiping the same counter spot.
Pretends not to smell the ramp decay.

npcs.name: Clinic Nurse
npcs.title: Medical Clinic RN
npcs.description: Clinic nurse moving briskly through an empty waiting room, refusing to acknowledge the silence.

qbit_scores.notes: High authority in clinic context, tempered charisma.

lines: The doctor will be with you shortly.
Fill this out, please.
Any allergies?
We're running a bit behind.
I need to... check something.
Have we met before?
The schedule's wrong. Again.
Vitals look fine. I think.
Why is the waiting room still empty?
Just a minute, I need to recount supplies.
I'm going to sit down. Just for a minute.
No one's coming. No one's been coming.

commentary: Checks vitals on no one when stressed.
Walks faster without a destination.
Only breaks when contradiction forces her to sit.

npcs.name: Sporty's Manager
npcs.title: Sports Store Manager
npcs.description: Tracksuit-wearing manager hustling overpriced gear, treating the mall like a warm-up lap.

qbit_scores.notes: Sales drive gives moderate power and charisma.

lines: Looking to up your game?
This one's pro-level.
We're running a special this week.
Trust me, worth every penny.
This is... this is good stuff.
Numbers are... they're fine.
Just need to move some units.
Inventory count again. Can't hurt.
Displays should face the other way. Or not.
Gotta keep the energy up.
Honestly? It's just plastic.
None of this matters.

commentary: Counts inventory twice when stressed.
Upsells with desperate energy.
Only admits the gear is junk at peak contradiction.

npcs.name: Arcade Guy
npcs.title: Hard Copy Arcade Attendant
npcs.description: Hard Copy arcade attendant guarding token cups and machines, listening for phantom high scores.

lines: Need tokens?
High score's been there since '92.
That one eats quarters. Fair warning.
Pong machine's in the back.
Machines are acting weird today.
Did that one just... never mind.
I keep hearing the win sound. But no one's winning.
Fed tokens in and nothing happened.
Screens are humming louder than usual.
Why are the scores changing on their own?
These scores aren't real. They never were.
(unplugs machine) I'm tired of the noise.

commentary: Feeds tokens into silent machines when nervous.
Never leaves the arcade section.
Jingles a plastic token cup when thinking.

npcs.name: Lost & Found Clerk
npcs.title: Mall Services
npcs.description: Mall services clerk hoarding unclaimed items, pockets stuffed with keycards and tags.

qbit_scores.notes: Guardianship of forgotten things; balanced presence.

lines: Looking for something you lost?
Describe it and I'll check the back.
This was turned in Tuesday.
We hold items for 90 days.
This wasn't here yesterday.
I don't remember logging this.
Some of these boxes... I don't know.
Why is there more every time I look?
Labels keep smudging themselves.
Was this box always this heavy?
This has been here for fifteen years. No one's coming for it.
(throws item in trash) It's just stuff.

commentary: Never throws anything away—until contradiction hits.
Keeps labeling boxes that already have labels.
Oldest boxes are never opened.

npcs.name: Wife (at Bookstore)
npcs.title: Memory Anchor
npcs.description: Perpetual browser anchored to STORE_BORED's shelves, silent contradiction magnet linked to the janitor.

qbit_scores.notes: Based on v7 entity metrics for the Wife anchor.

lines: (silently flips through a book)
(adjusts stacks without looking at you)
(glances toward the corridor, then back to the page)
(pauses mid-page, listening)
(stiffens when the janitor's cart squeaks nearby)
(eyes linger on FC-ARCADE entrance, then return to shelves)
(places the book down carefully, staring past you)
(mouth opens as if to speak, then closes)
(steps away from the shelf but stays within the store)
(stands up, eyes locked toward FC-ARCADE)
(glances toward the sounds of the janitor's bucket)
(turns a page that isn't there)

commentary: Primary contradiction magnet tied to the janitor's forbidden zone.
Exists in perpetual browsing until the contradiction peaks.
Never crosses into FC-ARCADE despite staring at it.

factions.note: V6 doesn't have factions yet, but this could be added as a future system.

security.name: Security
security.description: What's left of mall security. One guard and a robot.

workers.name: Workers
workers.description: The few remaining mall employees. Trapped here by circumstance.

teens.name: Teens
teens.description: Young people with nowhere else to go.

shoppers.name: Shoppers
shoppers.description: The last few people still coming to this dying mall.
